00099

00102                     'Invalid configuration of the \'dbal\' extension.',
00103                     tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception::EXCEPTION_DBAL_INVALID_CONF

00106

00110             // Checks if the DBAL is configured to use MySQL
00111             if( $dbalConf[ 'type' ] === 'native' ) {
00112                 
00113                 // No need for a particular setup
00114                 break;
00115             }
00116             
00117             // Checks the DBAL configuration
00118             if( !isset( $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'driver' ] )

00120                 || !isset( $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'password' ] )
00121                 || !isset( $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'host' ] )

00132             // Sets the connection infos from the DBAL configuration
00133             $driver = $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'driver' ];

00135             $pass   = $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'password' ];

00137             $db     = $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'database' ];
00138         }
00139

00141         if( !isset( $this->_drivers[ $driver ] ) ) {

00157             $this->_dsn .= ';port=' . $dbalConf[ 'config' ][ 'port' ];

00159         
00160         try {
00161             
00162             // Creates the PDO object
00163             $this->_pdo = new PDO( $this->_dsn, $user, $pass );

00165         } catch( Exception $e ) {

00187     /**
00188      * PHP method calls overloading
00189      * 
00190      * This method will reroute all the call on this object to the PDO object.
00191      * 
00192      * @param   string                          The name of the called method
00193      * @param   array                           The arguments for the called method
00194      * @return  mixed                           The result of the PDO method called
00195      * @throws  tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception If the called method does not exist
00196      */
00197     public function __call( $name, array $args = array() )
00198     {
00199         // Checks if the method can be called
00200         if( !is_callable( array( $this->_pdo, $name ) ) ) {
00201             
00202             // Called method does not exist
00203             throw new tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception(
00204                 'The method \'' . $name . '\' cannot be called on the PDO object',
00205                 tx_oop_Database_Layer_Exception::EXCEPTION_BAD_METHOD
00206             );
00207         }
00208         
00209         // Gets the number of arguments
00210         $argCount = count( $args );
00211         
00212         // We won't use call_user_func_array, as it cannot return references
00213         switch( $argCount ) {
00214             
00215             case 1:
00216                 
00217                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ] );
00218                 break;
00219             
00220             case 2:
00221                 
00222                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ], $args[ 1 ] );
00223                 break;
00224             
00225             case 3:
00226                 
00227                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ], $args[ 1 ], $args[ 2 ] );
00228                 break;
00229             
00230             case 4:
00231                 
00232                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ], $args[ 1 ], $args[ 2 ], $args[ 3 ] );
00233                 break;
00234                 break;
00235             
00236             case 5:
00237                 
00238                 return $this->_pdo->$name( $args[ 0 ], $args[ 1 ], $args[ 2 ], $args[ 3 ] , $args[ 4 ] );
00239                 break;
00240             
00241             default:
00242                 
00243                 return $this->_pdo->$name();
00244                 break;
00245         }
00246     }

00289     public function getRecord( $table, $id, $enableFields = true )
00290     {
00291         // WHERE clause for the enable fields
00292         $enableFieldsAddWhere = '';
00293         
00294         // Checks the TYPO3 mode and if we have to care about the enable fields
00295         if( $enableFields && TYPO3_MODE === 'BE' ) {
00296             
00297             // Gets the enable fields WHERE clause
00298             $enableFieldsAddWhere = t3lib_BEfunc::BEenableFields( $table );
00299             
00300         } elseif( $enableFields && TYPO3_MODE === 'BE' ) {
00301             
00302             // Should we show the hidden records (meaning we have a BE session running)
00303             $showHidden = ( $table === 'pages' ) ? $GLOBALS[ 'TSFE' ]->showHiddenPage : $GLOBALS[ 'TSFE' ]->showHiddenRecords;
00304             
00305             // Gets the enable fields WHERE clause
00306             $enableFieldsAddWhere = $GLOBALS[ 'TSFE' ]->sys_page->enableFields(
00307                 $table,
00308                 $showHidden
00309             );
00310         }
00311         
00312         // Primary key
00313         $pKey   = 'uid';
00314         
00315         // Parameters for the PDO query
00316         $params = array(
00317             ':id'      => $id
00318         );
00319         
00320         // Prepares the PDO query
00321         $query = $this->prepare(
00322             'SELECT * FROM ' . $table . '
00323              WHERE ' . $pKey . ' = :id'
00324            . $enableFieldsAddWhere . '
00325              LIMIT 1'
00326         );
00327         
00328         // Executes the PDO query
00329         $query->execute( $params );
00330         
00331         // Returns the record
00332         return $query->fetchObject();

00338     public function getRecordsByFields( $table, array $fieldsValues, $orderBy = '', $enableFields = true  )
00339     {
00340         // If $orderBy is not specified, checks if we have a default ORDER BY clause for the table
00341         if( !$orderBy && isset( $GLOBALS[ 'TCA' ][ $table ][ 'ctrl' ][ 'default_sortby' ] ) ) {
00342             
00343             // Default ORDER BY clause, as in the TCA
00344             $orderBy = ' ' . $GLOBALS[ 'TCA' ][ $table ][ 'ctrl' ][ 'default_sortby' ];
00345             
00346         } elseif( $orderBy ) {
00347             
00348             // Specified ORDER BY clause
00349             $orderBy = ' ORDER BY ' . $orderBy;
00350         }
00351         
00352         // WHERE clause for the enable fields
00353         $enableFieldsAddWhere = '';
00354         
00355         // Checks the TYPO3 mode and if we have to care about the enable fields
00356         if( $enableFields && TYPO3_MODE === 'BE' ) {
00357             
00358             // Gets the enable fields WHERE clause
00359             $enableFieldsAddWhere = t3lib_BEfunc::BEenableFields( $table );
00360             
00361         } elseif( $enableFields && TYPO3_MODE === 'BE' ) {
00362             
00363             // Should we show the hidden records (meaning we have a BE session running)
00364             $showHidden = ( $table === 'pages' ) ? $GLOBALS[ 'TSFE' ]->showHiddenPage : $GLOBALS[ 'TSFE' ]->showHiddenRecords;
00365             
00366             // Gets the enable fields WHERE clause
00367             $enableFieldsAddWhere = $GLOBALS[ 'TSFE' ]->sys_page->enableFields(
00368                 $table,
00369                 $showHidden
00370             );
00371         }
00372         
00373         // Primary key
00374         $pKey   = 'uid';
00375         
00376         // Starts the query
00377         $sql = 'SELECT * FROM ' . $table . ' WHERE ';
00378         
00379         // Parameters for the PDO query
00380         $params = array();
00381         
00382         // Process each field to check
00383         foreach( $fieldsValues as $fieldName => $fieldValue ) {
00384             
00385             // Adds the parameter
00386             $params[ ':' . $fieldName ] = $fieldValue;
00387             
00388             // Adds the statement
00389             $sql .= $fieldName . ' = :' . $fieldName . ' AND ';
00390         }
00391         
00392         // Removes the last 'AND'
00393         $sql = substr( $sql, 0, -5 );
00394         
00395         // Adds the WHERE clause for the enable fields
00396         $sql .= $enableFieldsAddWhere;
00397         
00398         // Adds the ORDER BY clause
00399         $sql .= $orderBy;
00400         
00401         // Prepares the PDO query
00402         $query = $this->prepare( $sql );
00403         
00404         // Executes the PDO query
00405         $query->execute( $params );
00406         
00407         // Storage
00408         $rows = array();
00409         
00410         // Process each row
00411         while( $row = $query->fetchObject() ) {
00412             
00413             // Stores the current row
00414             $rows[ $row->$pKey ] = $row;
00415         }
00416         
00417         // Returns the rows
00418         return $rows;
00419     }
